thread.title: Why was Paul Pierce simultaneously using two phones at the NBA Slam Dunk Contest?
thread.title_full: Why was Paul Pierce simultaneously using two phones at the NBA Slam Dunk Contest?

author: Molly Podlesny
title: Why was Paul Pierce simultaneously using two phones at the NBA Slam Dunk Contest?
text:
When one isn’t enough.
Paul Pierce, master of Twitter (I’m being facetious ) and all things social media, brought an extra phone to NBA All Star Weekend, just in case.
One of the phones has a very nice, cushy case. The other does not.
He looks to be concentrating very intently. For me, the only time I’ve used two phones is when I’m trying to post a Snapchat and Instagram story at once.
There are definitely other scenarios where you could need both, though.
when you're nervous your uber will show up before your uber eats pic.twitter.com/zFTw878H4k 
— Tim Cato (@tim_cato) February 19, 2017 Maybe he’s tweeting hot takes, incognito.
Someone tell Paul Pierce you can have more than one twitter account without buying two phones #TheTruth pic.twitter.com/7MxKcMSNhE 
— Candlestick Will (@CandlestickWill) February 19, 2017 Maybe he’s taking a photo of his Instagram, to tweet the photo he took.
Or, you know, if you’re Kevin Gates.
He might just be trying to find whole emoji photos on one phone, and links to Yahoo images on the other.
pic.twitter.com/SIyHJjDScR 
— Paul Pierce (@paulpierce34) July 8, 2015 Last day in office it's been an honor to meet President Obama https://t.co/7LggYpcG4N 
— Paul Pierce (@paulpierce34) January 20, 2017 Stay trying, Paul Pierce.
